abstract.title: Principia Metaphysica
abstract.subtitle: A Geometric Unification from M-Theory on TCS G₂ Manifolds

paragraphs.text: We present Principia Metaphysica, a geometric unification of the Standard Model, gravity, and cosmology derived from M-theory compactification on a single Twisted Connected Sum G₂ manifold. Beginning in a {D_bulk}-dimensional bulk spacetime of signature (24,2), Sp(2,R) gauge fixing yields an effective {D_after_sp2r}-dimensional intermediate stage, followed by compactification on the G₂ manifold to produce the observed {D_observable}D universe with three chiral fermion generations determined topologically from the flux-dressed Euler characteristic (n_gen = |χ_eff|/48 = {n_gen}).

All {total_predictions} measurable parameters of the extended Standard Model — including quark and lepton masses, mixing angles, gauge couplings, the Higgs boson mass, neutrino mass differences, and cosmological observables — are obtained from the manifold topology, flux quantization, and effective torsion class. Two numerical coefficients are transparently calibrated to the electroweak and GUT scales; the observed Higgs mass constrains one complex structure modulus. The remaining parameters emerge as pure predictions.

{predictions_within_1sigma} of {total_predictions} predictions lie within 1σ of current experimental data, with {exact_matches} exact matches, including the Higgs mass, atmospheric neutrino mass splitting, and the atmospheric mixing angle θ₂₃ = {theta_23}°. Additional geometric predictions — proton decay branching ratios and gravitational wave dispersion — await confirmation by future experiments.

footnote.text: Historical field names "Pneuma" and "Mashiach" reflect philosophical origins; modern terminology uses "Primordial Spinor Field" and "Attractor Scalar".
